column6: passed peacefully into the precious hands of her lord and savior
column14: the daughter of the late forest and minnie (bellew) holbrook. leeda is survived by her son and daughter-in-law
column16: joe jung; grandchildren including nikki grim and husband tom
column18: heather hennings and husband lucas; and great-grandchildren including evan
column21: and lawrence and parker grace hennings; and numerous other family and friends. she was preceded in death by her husband
column23: brenda jung; and 9 siblings including her twin sister
column24: freda cooksey. leeda was a member of northside baptist church for over 50 years. she was a veteran of wwii in the navy w. a. v. e. s
column25: where she was a truck driver helping to preserve our freedoms in this great country
column26: meeting and marrying dan who also served in the navy. she worked at international harvester from 1967 - 1982 sewing seat covers for their trucks. leeda was very talented with a passion for painting and sewing. she made many friends by tailoring for countless individuals in the area. she passed her talents on to her daughter brenda but kirby-not so much. however
column27: her real passions were for her church where she rarely missed a sunday or wednesday service
column29: and her family. she will be greatly missed and always loved by all the lives she touched. visitation will be held on monday
column31: 2015 from 6-8 p. m. at the jackson lytle & lewis funeral home- springfield. a celebration of leeda's life will be held on tuesday
column33: 2015 at 1 p. m. with pastor dave hill officiating
column34: at northside baptist church. entombment to follow at rose hill burial park. contributions may be made in memory of leeda to the northside baptist church
column36: ohio 45503. condolences may be expressed to the family at www. jacksonlytle. com. many thanks go out to nikki
column37: tom and joe for caring for mom until the very end. upcoming events. visitationjun 15. 6:00 pm - 8:00 pm jackson lytle & lewis life celebration center2425 n. limestone st. springfield
